New Records: Aaron Nola moved into heady company in the record book with some of Philadelphia’s franchise greats. His 56 wins at Citizens Bank Park ties him with former Phillies ace Cole Hamels for most in the 21 seasons at the ballpark. He also passed Curt Schilling and moved into seventh on the franchise’s career wins list with 102.
The Phillies have won a franchise-record 30 straight games when the starter goes at least seven innings. It’s the second-longest streak in baseball history.
Key Match Events: Aaron Nola tossed four-hit ball over seven shutout innings.
Nick Castellanos hit a three-run homer to lead the Philadelphia Phillies to a 5-0 win over the Houston Astros.
Bryce Harper sliced a single to left that set the stage for Castellanos' home run.
Alec Bohm added an RBI single in the seventh inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Nola earned a rousing standing ovation from the crowd of almost 40,000 fans after he finished the seventh inning.

Nola reflected on his achievement, saying, 'It’s pretty cool. Curt was an unbelievable pitcher. It’s cool to be up there with him and those guys. That’s all good stuff at the end of the day, but I just want to win for the team.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: At 41 years, 189 days, Justin Verlander is the oldest active pitcher in the major leagues.
Verlander struck out three, walked one, allowed four runs, and gave up seven hits in five innings.
Phillies LHP José Alvarado was expected to return this season after he was placed a day earlier on the restricted list for a personal matter.
